definition: fills the eyes (of a beautiful view, scene of desolation etc)
Manchu ethnic group
to fill/full/filled/packed/fully/completely/quite/to reach the limit/to satisfy/satisfied/contented
eye/item/section/list/catalogue/table of contents/order (taxonomy)/goal/name/title
glittering jewels to delight the eye (idiom)/fig. a dazzling lineup
lit. bumps and bruises everywhere (idiom); fig. an ugly shambles/devastation everywhere
lit. to fill one's eyes with glittering jewels/a literary masterpiece or sb of extraordinary talent (idiom)
thorns and brambles as far as eye can see (idiom); beset by troubles

sentences.english: The devastated old China is gone for ever.
sentences.chinese: 疮痍满目的旧中国一去不复返了。

sentences.english: A long thin table against the front wall was covered with gorgeous jewelry.
sentences.chinese: 而靠墙的一条长桌上则摆满了琳琅满目的首饰。

sentences.english: Two faint hopes flicker in the sodden gloom left by the earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 在地震过后的满目疮痍里闪烁着两线模糊的希望。

sentences.english: The market in the port:There are many small wares loaded to here by ship.
sentences.chinese: 口岸市场》口岸市场里琳琅满目的舶来小商品。

sentences.english: Regardless of Paris or other provinces, cafes everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 无论巴黎还是外省，咖啡馆满目皆是。

sentences.english: Shop windows display of goods dazzling, brilliant.
sentences.chinese: 商店的橱窗里陈列的商品琳琅满目，熠熠生辉。

sentences.english: The city was scarred by war.
sentences.chinese: 这座城市被战争弄得疮痍满目。

sentences.english: A rusty iron rod projected mournfully from one of the window ledges.
sentences.chinese: 一个窗架上突出一根生锈的铁棒，真是满目凄凉。

sentences.english: Everywhere near the scene of the car accident, destruction meets the eye.
sentences.chinese: 车祸现场疮痍满目一片狼藉。

sentences.english: Tiny street-side market stalls replaced trinket-laden shop windows.
sentences.chinese: 小小的街边货摊代替了货物琳琅满目的商店橱窗。

sentences.english: He has his Winter too of pale disfeature , or else he would forego his mortal nature.
sentences.chinese: 他也有满目苍凉的冬天，除非他走在命定的时日之前。

sentences.english: His visitor was shown into the study, where all the fishing tackle hung.
sentences.chinese: 客人给请进了书房，那里各种钓鱼用具挂得琳琅满目。

sentences.english: The land is scarred and many of the people have left.
sentences.chinese: 那儿土地已经变得满目疮痍，很多人都离开了。

sentences.english: The flood cut a wide swath in this area.
sentences.chinese: 洪水席卷了这一地区，满目一片疮痍。

sentences.english: A: The shop is a feast for the eyes indeed.
sentences.chinese: 你们店实在是琳琅满目，美不胜收。

sentences.english: On all sides, verdant sunset-bathed hills greet the eye.

definition: (of tears etc) filling the eyes/(of scenery etc) filling one's field of view
to be full of/completely
wound/skin ulcer/(fig.) the desolation of trauma/desolation in the aftermath of a disaster
everywhere/all over
eye-catching/conspicuous/obtrusive/striking/sticking out
fig. beautiful purples and brilliant reds (idiom); lit. beautiful flowers
to look/to raise one's eyes
fresh green
white as snow/pure white
to rustle in the air/to rustle/to sough/bleak/desolate/chilly
lit. bumps and bruises everywhere (idiom); fig. an ugly shambles/devastation everywhere
to appear before one's eyes/pleasing to the eye/nice to look at
red flowers and green willow/all the colors of spring
verdant and lush
as far as the eye can see (idiom)
whole sky
